intro: Crotalaria boranica, commonly known as the African heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in well-drained soils. Its seed pods are elongated and contain several small, kidney-shaped seeds. Crotalaria boranica is also noted for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial in agricultural settings.
